intro: Rauvolfia inebrians, commonly known as the Indian snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels. Its roots are the primary part used in traditional medicine. Rauvolfia inebrians contains alkaloids, such as reserpine, which have been historically used for their medicinal properties.
